qas.question: What did the RCC do with remnants of the monarchy?

answers.text: They purged monarchists and members of Idris' Senussi clan from Libya's political world and armed forces
Idris was sentenced to execution in absentia.

qas.question: How did Gaddafi view the elite?

answers.text: Gaddafi believed this elite were opposed to the will of the Libyan people and had to be expunged.

qas.question: What happened to the monarchists and and journalists?

answers.text: "People's Courts" were founded to try various monarchist politicians and journalists, and though many were imprisoned, none were executed.

qas.question: What clan was King Idris part of?
Along with journalists, who was tried in the People's Courts?
How many people were executed by the People's Courts?
What sentence was given to the absent King Idris?
Along with the Senussi, who was purged from the military?

context: The coup completed, the RCC proceeded with their intentions of consolidating the revolutionary government and modernizing the country. <a0_0>They purged <a8_0>monarchists<a8_0/> and members of Idris' <a4_0>Senussi<a4_0/> clan from Libya's political world and armed forces<a0_0/>; <a2_0>Gaddafi believed this elite were opposed to the will of the Libyan people and had to be expunged.<a2_0/> <a3_0>"People's Courts" were founded to try various <a5_0>monarchist politicians<a5_0/> and journalists, and though many were imprisoned, <a6_0>none<a6_0/> were executed.<a3_0/> <a1_0>Idris was sentenced to <a7_0>execution<a7_0/> in absentia.
